member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Connections.Peer.IPeerConnection.EndPoint
member.summary: The endpoint of the remote peer. Will be null for web seeds or http seeds.

member.summary: The EndPoint to which the Listener is bound.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Connections.Peer.IPeerConnectionListener.PreferredLocalEndPoint
member.summary: The EndPoint to which the Listener will attempt to be bound. If the preferred endpoint has it's port set to 0, then the actual port the listener is bound to will be set in the property after has been invoked.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Connections.EncryptionType.PlainText
member.summary: Nothing is encrypted. This is the fastest but allows deep packet inspection to detect the bittorrent handshake. If connections are being closed before the handshake completes, or very soon after it completes, then it's possible that the ISP is closing them, and so RC4 based methods may prevent that from happening.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Connections.EncryptionType.RC4Header
member.summary: Encryption is applied to the initial handshaking process only. Once the connection has been established all further data is sent in plain text. This is the second fastest and should prevent deep packet inspection from detecting the bittorrent handshake.

member.name: F:MonoTorrent.Connections.EncryptionType.RC4Full
member.summary: Encryption is applied to the initial handshake and to all subsequent data transfers.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Dht.ITransferMonitor.BytesSent
member.summary: Total bytes sent since the start of the session.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Dht.ITransferMonitor.BytesReceived
member.summary: Total bytes received since the start of the session.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Dht.ITransferMonitor.DownloadRate
member.summary: Estimate of the amount of data received every second, in bytes/second.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Dht.ITransferMonitor.UploadRate
member.summary: Estimate of the amount of data sent every second, in bytes/second.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.Logging.LoggerFactory.Factory
member.summary: The factory method used to create new ILogger instances. The parameter is the for the class the ILogger is associated with. You can return for any class to disable logging for that class.

member.name: T:MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.IPieceRequester
member.summary: Allows an IPiecePicker implementation to create piece requests for specific peers and then add them to the peers message queue. If the limits on maximum concurrent piece requests are ignored

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.IPieceRequester.InEndgameMode
member.summary: Should return if the underlying piece picking algorithm has entered 'endgame mode' as defined by the bittorrent specification.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.IPieceRequester.AddRequests(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.ValueTuple{MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.IRequester,MonoTorrent.ReadOnlyBitField}})
member.summary: Should enqueue piece requests for any peer who is has capacity.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.IPieceRequester.AddRequests(MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.IRequester,MonoTorrent.ReadOnlyBitField,System.ReadOnlySpan{MonoTorrent.ReadOnlyBitField})
member.summary: Attempts to enqueue more requests for the specified peer.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.IPieceRequester.Initialise(MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.IPieceRequesterData,MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.IMessageEnqueuer,System.ReadOnlySpan{MonoTorrent.ReadOnlyBitField})
member.param: The files, size and piecelength for the torrent.
Enqueues request, or cancellation, messages with the peer

These bitfields represent pieces which have successfully downloaded and passed a hash check, pieces which have successfully downloaded but have not hash checked yet or pieces which have not yet been hash checked by the library and so it is not known whether they should be requested or not.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.IRequester.PreferredRequestAmount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the number of blocks to request. If the value is greater than 1 it will be rounded up to 1 full piece.

member.name: T:MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.IStreamingPieceRequester
member.summary: Allows files to be accessed while they are downloading

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.IStreamingPieceRequester.SeekToPosition(MonoTorrent.ITorrentManagerFile,System.Int64)
member.summary: Cancel any pending requests and then issue new requests so we immediately download pieces from the new high priority set.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.IStreamingPieceRequester.ReadToPosition(MonoTorrent.ITorrentManagerFile,System.Int64)
member.summary: Inform the picker that we have sequentially read data and so will need to update the high priority set without cancelling pending requests.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.PieceRequesterSettings.AllowPrioritisation
member.summary: When set to false, is not taken into account when choosing pieces. Files marked as 'DoNotDownload' will be downloaded. Defaults to .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.PieceRequesterSettings.AllowRandomised
member.summary: When set to false, pieces will be selected sequentially. If is enabled, then set of pieces which will be available to choose from will be reduced to the 'rarest' set first, and then the picker will choose sequentially from that subset. If you need true linear picking, you must disable as well as . Defaults to .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.PieceRequesterSettings.AllowRarestFirst
member.summary: When set to false, the rarest subset of pieces will not be computed. Defaults to .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PiecePicking.PieceRequesterSettings.MaximumDuplicateRequests
member.summary: The maximum number of concurrent requests which will be issued for the same block of data during 'end game' mode. A higher value can decrease the time it takes for the final few pieces to be received at the cost of downloading excess data. Blocks which are not received within a reasonable amount of time will be re-requested from another peer. Defaults to 2.

member.name: E:MonoTorrent.PieceWriter.IBlockCache.ReadFromCache
member.summary: This event is raised every time a block is successfully read from the cache

member.name: E:MonoTorrent.PieceWriter.IBlockCache.ReadThroughCache
member.summary: This event is raised every time a block cannot be read from the cache, and is read from the underlying instead.

member.name: E:MonoTorrent.PieceWriter.IBlockCache.WrittenToCache
member.summary: This event is raised when a block is written to the cache.

member.name: E:MonoTorrent.PieceWriter.IBlockCache.WrittenThroughCache
member.summary: This event is raised when a new block is written directly by the underlying , or when a block is removed from the cache and is written by the underlying .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PieceWriter.IBlockCache.CacheHits
member.summary: The number of bytes read from the cache.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PieceWriter.IBlockCache.CacheUsed
member.summary: The number of bytes currently used by the cache.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PieceWriter.IBlockCache.Capacity
member.summary: The capacity of the cache, in bytes.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PieceWriter.IBlockCache.Writer
member.summary: Pieces will be written to this when they are evicted from the cache.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.PieceWriter.IBlockCache.ReadAsync(MonoTorrent.ITorrentManagerInfo,MonoTorrent.BlockInfo,System.Memory{System.Byte})
member.summary: Reads data from the cache and flushes it to disk, or reads the data from disk if it is not available in the cache.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.PieceWriter.IBlockCache.ReadFromCacheAsync(MonoTorrent.ITorrentManagerInfo,MonoTorrent.BlockInfo,System.Memory{System.Byte})
member.summary: If the block of data is available in the cache, the data is read into the buffer and the method returns true. If the block is unavailable, the buffer will not be modified and the method will return false.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.PieceWriter.IBlockCache.SetCapacityAsync(System.Int64)
member.summary: Set the max capacity, in bytes.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.PieceWriter.IBlockCache.SetPolicyAsync(MonoTorrent.PieceWriter.CachePolicy)
member.summary: Sets the cache policy.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PortForwarding.IPortForwarder.Active
member.summary: True if the port forwarding is enabled

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PortForwarding.IPortForwarder.Mappings
member.summary: The list of mappings which have been registered. If the mapping was successfully established it will be in the list. If an error occurred creating the mapping it will be in the list, otherwise it will be in the list.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.PortForwarding.IPortForwarder.RegisterMappingAsync(MonoTorrent.PortForwarding.Mapping)
member.summary: Forwards a port on a NAT-PMP or uPnP capable router.
member.param: The mapping to try and create.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.PortForwarding.IPortForwarder.UnregisterMappingAsync(MonoTorrent.PortForwarding.Mapping,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Removes a port forwarding mapping from the router.
member.param: The mapping to remove from the router. to use for the external and internal port number.
If the token is cancelled then the port map may not be fully removed from the router.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.PortForwarding.IPortForwarder.StartAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Begins searching for any compatible port forwarding devices. Refreshes any forwarded ports automatically before the mapping expires.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.PortForwarding.IPortForwarder.StopAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Removes any port map requests and stops searching for compatible port forwarding devices. Cancels any pending ForwardPort requests.

member.name: M:MonoTorrent.PortForwarding.IPortForwarder.StopAsync(System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Removes any port map requests and stops searching for compatible port forwarding devices. Cancels any pending ForwardPort requests.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PortForwarding.Mapping.PublicPort
member.summary: Connections made to the port will be forwarded to the .

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PortForwarding.Mapping.PrivatePort
member.summary: The internal port bound by a local socket/listener.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PortForwarding.Mapping.Protocol
member.summary: The protocol which has been mapped.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PortForwarding.Mappings.Created
member.summary: A list of mappings which have been successfully created

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PortForwarding.Mappings.Pending
member.summary: A list of mappings which will be created as soon as a compatible uPnP or NAT-PMP router is discovered.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.PortForwarding.Mappings.Failed
member.summary: A list of mappings which could not be created. This can happen if the public port is already in use and is mapped to a different IP address in the local network.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.TrackerServer.AnnounceRequest.ClientAddress
member.summary: This is the IPAddress/Port that the client is listening for incoming connections on. If the announce request contained an 'ip' parameter then it is used, otherwise the actual IP from the request is used.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.TrackerServer.AnnounceRequest.Downloaded
member.summary: The total number of bytes downloaded since the 'Started' event was sent.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.TrackerServer.AnnounceRequest.Event
member.summary: The event, if any, associated with this announce

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.TrackerServer.AnnounceRequest.Left
member.summary: The number of bytes which still need to be downloaded to make the torrent 100% complete.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.TrackerServer.AnnounceRequest.HasRequestedCompact
member.summary: True if the peers should be returned in compact form.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.TrackerServer.AnnounceRequest.InfoHash
member.summary: The infohash of the torrent this request is associated with.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.TrackerServer.AnnounceRequest.Key
member.summary: An arbitrary identifier generated by the client which can be used to track the client even if it's IP address changes. This is never shared with other peers.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.TrackerServer.AnnounceRequest.IsValid
member.summary: Returns false if any required parameters are missing from the request. If this occurs the 'Response' dictionary will be populated with the appropriate error message.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.TrackerServer.AnnounceRequest.NumberWanted
member.summary: The number of peers the client wants to receive. If unspecified then the tracker default amount be returned.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.TrackerServer.AnnounceRequest.PeerId
member.summary: The 20 byte identifier for the peer. This is shared with other peers when a non-compact response is returned.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.TrackerServer.AnnounceRequest.Port
member.summary: The port the client is listening for incoming connections on.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.TrackerServer.AnnounceRequest.TrackerId
member.summary: The first time a peer announces to a tracker, we send it the TrackerId of this tracker. Subsequent announce requests should send that value.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.TrackerServer.AnnounceRequest.Uploaded
member.summary: The total amount of bytes uploaded since the 'Started' event was sent.

member.name: P:MonoTorrent.InfoHashes.V1OrV2
member.summary: If the V1 hash is non-null, then it is returned. Otherwise the V2 hash is returned. As a result, the V1 hash will be returned if both the V1 and V2 hash are non-null.
